org.team4159.boths.views

Class BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.team4159.boths.views.BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket
  • Enclosing class:
    BidirectionalWebSocketView

    public static class BidirectionalWebSocketView.BidirectionalWebSocket
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a socket which should be used to communicate with a WebSocket client.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the WebSocket connection.
      boolean isOpen()
      Checks whether the WebSocket connection is still open.
      boolean messageAvailable()
      Checks whether there is a message available in the buffer or if the client is in the process of sending another message.
      BaseWebSocketView.Message nextMessage()
      Returns the next message the client sends.
      void sendMessage(BaseWebSocketView.Message msg)
      Sends a message.
      void sendMessage(byte[] data)
      Sends a message with binary data.
      void sendMessage(java.lang.String str)
      Sends a message with text data.

    • Method Detail

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen()
        Checks whether the WebSocket connection is still open. The handler must return when this method returns false.
        Returns:
        true if the WebSocket connection is still open.

      • messageAvailable

        public boolean messageAvailable()
        Checks whether there is a message available in the buffer or if the client is in the process of sending another message.
        Returns:
        true if a message is available for reading or will be available for reading shortly.

      • nextMessage

        public BaseWebSocketView.Message nextMessage()
        Returns the next message the client sends. If messageAvailable() returns false, this method may block for a substantial amount of time. This method will automatically respond to PING packets and will ignore PONG packets.
        Returns:
        The next message.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(byte[] data)
        Sends a message with binary data.
        Parameters:
        data - The binary data to send.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String str)
        Sends a message with text data.
        Parameters:
        str - The text to send.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(BaseWebSocketView.Message msg)
        Sends a message.
        Parameters:
        msg - The BaseWebSocketView.Message to send.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the WebSocket connection.
